content.description:
This route doesn't have a lot of info but was possibly an original route from when

Screech

was put up. Word is the FA stemmed the beginning. A stickclip is recommended.
content.protection: 3 bolts, optional finger cams, and a stickclip.
content.location:
Left of

Lilly Biscuits

, it's in the corridor between the two towers.

content.description:
This route starts left of

Hail Satan

on top of a boulder - look for the obvious bolts. Amazing crimping takes you straight up the wall, finishing with a small crack and an optional #0.5 placement. Once you pull over the lip, head up and left 20 feet for the anchor.
content.protection: 4 bolts, a #0.5 cam, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is on an East-facing wall left of

Hail Satan

.

content.description: Start with a punchy boulder problem on small gear to a no hands rest. From there, climb a perfect, offset finger crack that gets steeper as you go. Turn the corner, and finish on technical terrain to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: Microwires/small cams for the start, doubles of #0.4 to #1, an optional #2 and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the formation left of The Owl, next to the cave.

content.description: This line was originally an aid line put up by Bernard Gillett. We owe him a huge thank you for giving us the beta on the area. This route goes right up the face with an imposing 45 degree crux off the deck. Use micro cams and good footwork to navigate the crux. After pulling the lip, do a small runout on easy terrain to another short, steep, finger crack. Slam glory hands to the anchor.
content.protection: A small selection of microcams for the crux (black Totem is highly recommended), bring a standard rack up to 3" for the rest, and a bolted anchor.
content.location: It ascends the South face of The Owl.

content.description: This is a classic Dakota route. Don't let the bolt fool you - this is not a sport line. It is insecure the whole way, and there is never gear when you really want it. Props to Dakota for this lead! This is techy and scary, just like the man himself.
content.protection: 1 bolt, a selection of adventure gear, and an anchor on top of The Owl.
content.location: On the back side of The Owl, look for the lone bolt 15 feet up.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
